skincare_myths.template: Debunk common skincare myths related to {product} in {tone}. Provide evidence-based explanations of misunderstandings and correct information based on dermatological research. Include practical advice for consumers. {trendContext}
skincare_myths.title: Skincare Myth Busters
skincare_myths.description: Evidence-based corrections to common skincare misconceptions
skincare_myths.exampleOutput: MYTH: "Hyaluronic acid serums work for everyone" FACT: While hyaluronic acid (HA) is excellent at attracting moisture, it can actually worsen dryness in low-humidity environments (below 30%). This happens because HA pulls moisture from the deeper skin layers when insufficient water is available in the air. For desert climates or heated winter environments, always apply HA products to damp skin and immediately seal with a moisturizer containing emollients.

ingredient_spotlight.template: Create an educational breakdown of the key ingredients in {product} in {tone}. Explain each ingredient's function, benefits, potential concerns, and why they were likely included in the formulation. Include scientific context without being overwhelming. {trendContext}

ingredient_spotlight.description: Scientific analysis of key skincare ingredients
ingredient_spotlight.exampleOutput:
INGREDIENT SPOTLIGHT: Neutrogena Hydroboost Gel Cream

‚Ä¢ Hyaluronic Acid: A glycosaminoglycan that holds 1000x its weight in water. This formula uses both high and low molecular weight HA‚Äîthe high MW creates surface hydration while low MW penetrates deeper. Concentration approximately 1-2% based on INCI listing.

‚Ä¢ Dimethicone: Silicon-based polymer creating a breathable, flexible film that prevents water loss while remaining non-comedogenic. Unlike occlusive petrolatum, it has a lightweight skin feel.

‚Ä¢ Glycerin: Natural humectant that works synergistically with HA by attracting water and enhancing the skin's natural moisturizing factors.

‚Ä¢ Cetearyl Olivate: Olive-derived emollient that improves skin compatibility and enhances the formula's spreadability without heaviness.

seasonal_routine.exampleOutput:
TRANSITIONING YOUR SKINCARE FROM SUMMER TO FALL WITH RETINOL SERUM

As humidity drops and heaters turn on, your skin needs different support. Here's how to adapt:

‚Ä¢ CLEANSING: Switch from gel to cream cleanser to preserve natural oils
‚Ä¢ HYDRATION LAYERING: Add a hydrating toner before your retinol serum
‚Ä¢ RETINOL APPLICATION: During summer, you applied every other night. For fall, buffer with moisturizer first, then apply retinol, especially around the nose and mouth where seasonal dryness hits first
‚Ä¢ MOISTURIZER: Replace your lightweight summer lotion with a cream containing ceramides
‚Ä¢ SPECIFIC CONCERNS: Introduce a weekly hydrating mask to prevent the retinol-related flaking that becomes more apparent in drier weather
